text: in a run-down house in northern Egypt we
met a traumatized child at just 14 he
was arrested in a demonstration he was
charged with supporting the now banned
Muslim Brotherhood group for 10 days he
claims he was held with adults in a
police station they used to punch me
slapped me on the face kick me and
insult me repeatedly some of my inmates
told me they were stripped naked
electric shocked and beaten with sticks
now whenever I hear a police siren I
feel they are coming to get me 14 year
old Mazen says he had an even more
brutal experience he was accused of
joining the Muslim Brotherhood and taken
to a police station in a dawn raid there
he told his mom he suffered horrific
abuse he told me the electric shocked
his genitals and sexually assaulted him
with a stick I asked him are you injured
he told me I was bleeding but now it
stopped they hooked him up left him
dangling from the ceiling and kept
beating him there are no exact figures
of child datin ease in Egypt but
independent rights groups say there are
at least hundreds being held behind me
is one of Egypt's main juvenile
detention centers Egyptian law says
children should be held in places like
this many of them are but not all these
institutions are supposed to provide
care and guidance to minors but in fact
they suffer severe violations
according to local NGOs and human rights
lawyers it is illegal to place children
with others yet this happens all the
time in in prisons and police stations
those who are moved to juvenile centers
are not in a better condition either
they are beaten sexually harassed and
verbally abuse the interior ministry did
not reply to repeated interview requests
in December it issued us
statement about Mazen saying he was sent
to a doctor to check him after his
lawyer claimed he was sexually assaulted
the medical report proved all these
claims to be untrue behind these walls
many children are believed to be
suffering in confinement even after they
leave the terrible memories continue to
haunt them
Selena Biel BBC news chiral
